metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4554 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
mime_header.cc in Squid before 3.5.18 allows remote attackers to bypass intended same-origin restrictions and possibly conduct cache-poisoning attacks via a crafted HTTP Host header, aka a "header smuggling" issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-cgi - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-common - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid-purge - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squid3 - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
squidclient - 3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> see also regression fix in: http://bugs.squid-cache.org/show_bug.cgi?id=4515

criterions.comment: squid3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.12-1ubuntu7.2').
